logic

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Ball
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class implements the ball and its behavior.

    This class manages the information that defines the ball inside the game's Environment and implements its behavior. Some of the information of the ball are its coordinates inside the grid world, its moving information or the event controls. The balls behavior can be easily defined. If any player sets a direction for the ball to move, the ball moves to that direction until it reaches the destination or until and interrupting event takes place. An interrupting event may be a goal scored, a ball going outside the field or a player catching the ball.

    Version:
    v0.1 04/18/2014
    Author:
    Eduard de Torres

    • Method Detail

      • initBall

        public void initBall()
        Initializes the ball position and moving direction.

        Initializes the ball position to the center of the game field and sets the moving direction to -1 which means that the ball isn't moving.

      • getBall_x

        public int getBall_x()
        Returns the x-coordinate of the ball inside the grid world.

        the x-coordinate of the ball inside the grid world.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(int x,
                int y,
                boolean team_a,
                int team_number)
        Gives a new direction to where the ball should be moved to.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the balls destination.
        y - the y-coordinate of the balls destination.
        team_a - true if the player setting the ball in motion is part of team A.
        team_number - the number of the player inside its team.

      • isStopped

        public boolean isStopped()
        Checks if the ball is stopped or moving.
        Returns:
        true if the ball is stopped.
